episodes.title: Pete Perisin and Shelby Elias v. residents of Barrington IL. A PBCC public relations disaster!
episodes.description:
Barrington. A $3 million quid pro quo?
The President and Vice-president of the South Barrington Park District Board of Commissioners are Pete Perisin and Shelby Elias. These two have been instrumental in pushing through the Plymouth Brethren “church” school and superstore deal, by fair means and foul, despite the glaring evidence that this would be detrimental to the community and to the Park District’s tax base.
The million dollar question is…why?
I can tell you exactly why. Pete Perisin and Shelby Elias are both realtors.
https://www.coldwellbankerhomes.com/.../peter.../aid_89123/
https://www.compass.com/agents/2306278/
To understand the significance of this, I have to explain some of the extraordinary rules that the PBCC imposes on its members. The PBCC place great importance on living in close proximity to their Gospel Hall or “Church” – ideally within walking distance, but at the very most, within 10 miles.
The present Gospel Hall for the Chicago PBCC congregation is in Melrose Park, due south of O’Hare International Airport. The proposed new Gospel Hall is 27 miles away by road. The 10 mile radius catchment areas for the old and new hall have no overlap – so when the new hall is built, and the old hall closed - every single PBCC household will be moving to the Barrington area – and there are more than 60 households. With the need to both sell their old houses, and to buy new ones, that is 130 or more real estate transactions over the period of a year or two.
The brethren in any congregation will typically all be loyal customers of one or two realtors. That is because they have very specific housing requirements relating to their religious rules, and there is usually an informal “group buying” arrangement where the realtor will tip off the PBCC about suitable properties for homes or halls in exchange for the loyalty of the community. It would be extremely simple for PBCC elders Steve Johnstone and Dale Diener to ensure that Pete Perisin and Shelby Elias got the lion’s share of the brethren members' real estate business, in exchange for facilitating the purchase and rezoning of “Area N” at a remarkably cheap price.
What would a deal like this be worth to our “volunteer” Commissioners, Perisin and Elias?
Brethren do not live in cheap homes. They do not live in townhouses, or apartments. They like to be as far from their neighbors as possible, and nothing suits them better than a McMansion on at least an acre of ground. Their average home value is going to be at least $800,000.
So assuming 130 real estate transactions – 65 sales and 65 purchases, that is a total of $104 million. Taking a conservative realtor’s commission rate of 3% , our friends the President and Vice-President could benefit to the tune of $3,120,000.
The whole scheme is a realtor's wet dream. What other possible use for the land could bring 130 high value transactions in to their bank accounts?
I would suggest that the lawyer for the “various residents of Barrington” brushes up on “Conflict of Interest” law.

episodes.title: Barrington protest PBCC church and school plan.
episodes.description:
The Plymouth Brethren Christian Church plan to build a 17,000sq ft church, plus a school and superstore in Barrington IL, a suburb of Chicago. here a former member of the PBCC explains exactly what a PBCC "church" will look like, and exposes the PBCC representative Dale Diener's lie that the capacity of the hall will be only 1000 persons. We also get a tour inside a PBCC meeting hall and the reason for the mysterious sliding doors and outsize A/C  units is explained. 
WE go on to look at Bruce D Hales's ministry, and explain what "4 square feet per person" means in the context of a 17,000sq feet hall. We look at the "circus tent" outside a Manitoba PBCC hall, and explain that with each giant "city hall": the PBCC build, there will be several smaller "local" halls required. 
We look at how the PBCC regard their neighbours, and using quotes from their own printed literature, expose the two-faced way in which they seem to offer a friendly hand while despising and hating non-members as "worldlies".
PBCC Campus&Co superstores like the one proposed usually contain a well stocked liquor store. Are the brethren really planning to put a liquor store and a school in the same building?
We look at how the Brethren rationalise and excuse using lies and deception to obtain what the church needs from the "hostile" world, which it regards as satanic. 
Any community faced with the prospect of the Plymouth Brethren seeking planning permission for a "Gospel Hall" needs to study this video carefully.
Note 1. All ministry quotes are from Subject Index to the Ministry of B D Hales, Copyright Bible and Gospel trust 2014. 
Note 2. Correction: The  A/C units in the 17,000 sq ft room shown are not the size of a semi-trailer - they are about 8' x 27' - more the size of a  school bus.

episodes.title: Investigative Journalist Justin Ling speaks out about the Plymouth Brethren Christian Church (PBCC)
episodes.description: This piece largely concerns an Evangelical sect known as the Plymouth Brethren Christian Church it is a  particularly insular organization, it's not very big, maybe 50 000 members worldwide and it it rests on the theology that the rest of the world is wicked, only members of this church are good and pure and therefore they shouldn't associate with anybody outside the church, even other Evangelical denominations much less other religions or non-believers and that begets I think what has been alleged is cult-like behavior. They become increasingly insular, anybody who tries to leave gets excommunicated, denounced and what we've seen in Australia, New Zealand and elsewhere is this practice of hiring private investigators to go after people who have left the church and those who have spoken out about it, and seemingly that's what happened here in Canada, allegedly that's what happened here.  This Wallace fellow was was hired by this semi-prominent lawyer I think working independently, a guy by the name of Gerald Chipeur (supposedly Pierre Poilievre's dad) and Chipeur hires him to go track down this one particular whistleblower who had left the church and and kind of rung the bell about some of these shady practices. Well over the course of of doing that contract Wallace has a falling out with Chipeur and with the church and some others and he actually goes to the guy he was supposed to be surveilling and said "Hey listen, the church that has it out to get you, they want me to track you down, they want me to take your cell phone, they might even want me to kidnap you. I think you should be aware and maybe you want to skip town." So this is all well supported by these documents and this is all some pretty crazy stuff. I mean you know this is kind of Scientology-like behavior, this is the sort of thing we should be aware of and alert to and worried about. This sort of behavior we should not be tolerating from from a religious sect in this country and it's worth  a fair bit of scrutiny.

episodes.title: Plymouth Brethren at Stephen Harper's victory speech 2011
episodes.description:
Five prominent members of the Plymouth Brethren Christian Church were lined up on the front row VIP seats at Stephen Harper's victory speech in Calgary on the night of the 2011 election. They are Chuck Truan from Detroit MI, Roy Taylor from London, ON, Brad Mitchell from Langley, BC, Ron Barnes from Calgary, AB, now living in Knoxville TN and Ralph Mooney from Woodstock, ON.
Brad Mitchel is the founder of Klondike Lubricants, for which the Klondike Papers were named. Chuck Truan and Brad Mitchell have worked closely with crooked Conservative lawyer Gerald Chipeur for many years stalking and harassing former PBCC members in order to silence them from speaking out about abuse within the cult. Brad Mitchell criminally obtained phone logs of Richard Marsh's wife and others using the Universal Business Team (UBT) access to telecoms carriers. 
After the speech, Harper walked to the edge of the stage and shook hands with each of the PBCC members, starting with Chuck, who is not even a Canadian resident or citizen.
